alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 09 at 5:54AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...THREAT OF RIVER FLOODING WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT FOR THE SKOKOMISH RIVER IN MASON COUNTY... Heavy rain over the south slopes of the Olympics Tuesday night and Wednesday could drive the Skokomish River in Mason county above flood stage beginning Wednesday morning. Rainfall totals of 3-5 inches are expected during this time along the south slopes of the Olympics. Snow levels will be in the 6000-7500 foot range. This combined with the river already running high from recent rains could cause minor to moderate flooding for the Skokomish River beginning Wednesday morning. Please monitor the latest river forecasts from the National Weather Service for additional information.
